title: Why Mark Ronson has apologised for 'coming out' as sapiosexual
text:
From Cosmopolitan

Music producer Mark Ronson has apologised for comments he made last week, where he seemed to 'come out' as sapiosexual.

Being sapiosexual means a person is sexually attracted to intelligence, and prioritises that over other attributes in a partner.

Appearing on Good Morning Britain last week, Mark was asked if he's "identifying as a man who likes intellect?"

Mark replied, "Yeah, I didn’t know that there was a word for it. We were all arguing backstage in the dressing room with a couple of your producers. And yes, I feel like I identify as sapiosexual."



However, Mark has now said in an interview with Rolling Stone that he wasn't attempting to 'come out' when he made the comments.

Admitting that he wasn't fully informed about what it means to identify as sapiosexual, Mark said, “I do not consider myself part of any marginalised community and I apologise if anybody misunderstood or took offence to it.”

Mark said he later realised that his comments about sapiosexuality could be misinterpreted as him 'coming out'.

"It sounds like I went on a TV show to be like, ‘Guys, I have some big news!’ And the fact that I would go on and sort of declare myself — like as a heterosexual white male — part of any marginalised community was terrifying to me, or just embarrassing," he explained.

While Mark has been criticised for not being informed about sapiosexuality, others believe that those who identify as sapiosexual can't be considered a marginalised group in the same way as other members of the LGBTQ+ community.

Lmao Mark Ronson came out...sort of??? — Azealia’s Rant Wig (@turnandstomp) September 19, 2019

i'm happy the guy fancies clever people - so do i. but maybe let's not use the language of oppression ("comes out") for something which has absolutely no negative social consequence or historic prejudice attached https://t.co/HIWiJshBXA — Sirena Bergman 🌈 (@sirenabergman) September 20, 2019

One reddit user believes that "personality preferences are not sexualities."

You aren't sapiosexual, you are just classist. Thank you for coming to my TED Talk. — Dr Eleanor Janega (@GoingMedieval) September 19, 2019

Meanwhile, others think that "sapiosexuality is the height of ~queer because cool~ing" and that it's irresponsible and problematic to include sapiosexuality as part of the queer community.
